cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, then forecast to turn northeast on Monday and east on Tuesday, keeping the center just off the North Carolina Outer Banks before accelerating east-northeast away from the U.S. Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks (no direct landfall expected farther north)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect north of Surf City NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Surf City to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North Carolina coast and Outer Banks; long-period swells spreading to the entire U.S. Mid-Atlantic shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible; less than 10% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal anomalies or very shallow surge possible along the upper Chesapeake Bay, but widespread surge >3 ft is not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 0.5–1.5 inches of rain to the Baltimore area between late Monday night and Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf along the Delmarva and New Jersey beaches could disrupt harbor pilot and lightering operations
